alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bell and central Knox Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Yeager, or over Barbourville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Baughman, Himyar and Trosper around 450 PM EDT. Old Flat Lick, Dewitt, Flat Lick and Barnyard around 455 PM EDT. Walker, Fourmile and Scalf around 500 PM EDT. Pineville, Blanche, Rella, Arjay, Cary, Straight Creek, Wallsend, Wasioto and Mills around 505 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kettle Island, Field, East Pineville, Ponza, Callaway, Stony Fork Junction, Miracle, Varilla and Calvin. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 12 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
